review_title: CEO was out of touch and lacked transparency
pros: The employees care deeply about their patients, which makes working here feel like you are directly impacting the health of the community. I worked with some really incredible professionals, a true community hospital in the best sense.
cons: I worked here for three years and there were three different CEO's in that time. I think it could be said that the quality of the leadership went from good to horrible. The current CEO lacks transparency and to be honest, a personality, which made the employees very uneasy about the direction of the organization and the security of their jobs.

pros: Some amazing and caring people work here, small enough that you know a lot of the patients.
cons:
-HR will not listen to you unless you are a supervisor or manager.
-requesting PTO time is a joke because you will never get the time you want off unless you are a supervisor, even if you request it month in advance. 
-doctors notes don't matter if you are sick, a day out is a day out no excuse. Even if you're in the ER. 
-more than seven minutes late is marked as a missed day and you're still expected to work. 
-favoritism heavily effect your Job.

pros: Have met some wonderful and caring people here, and have learned a lot
cons: Favoritism, inexperienced and overextended mid-level management making staffing/workload decisions that don't make practical sense
